info.name: Gracile fasciculus
info.description: The gracile fasciculus is part of the dorsal or posterior column of white matter along the entire length of the spinal cord. It includes large, uncrossed, primary afferent fibers carrying tactile, vibratory and proprioceptive input from the lower extremity and the body below approximately T6.  While most of these fibers will terminate in the gracile nuclei in the caudal medulla, a substantial portion will terminate in Clark's nucleus (nucleus dorsalis) in the lumbar and lower thoracic aspect of the spinal cord.  Note that in upper thoracic and cervical cord segments, the dorsal column includes a more laterally located fiber bundle, the cuneate fasciculus.  The fibers in the cuneate fasciculus carry the same modalities of sensation from the upper extremity and the body above approximately T6.
